intro: Voyria chionea, commonly known as the white snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Oleaceae family, which includes jasmine and lilac. The plant is characterized by its fragrant, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and natural landscapes.
